title: 112_hr2676
content: The Small Business Health Relief Act of 2011 aims to make coverage affordable for small businesses and increase consumer control. It includes provisions to protect American jobs, increase flexibility for small businesses, provide more choices for Americans, protect patients from higher premiums, ensure affordable coverage, repeal restrictions on over-the-counter medicines, and allow individuals to keep their preferred coverage. The Small Business Health Relief Act of 2011 aims to make coverage affordable for small businesses by protecting American jobs and increasing flexibility. It also aims to provide more choices for Americans by repealing certain provisions of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to allow high deductible health plans with health savings accounts to meet coverage requirements. This change aims to increase flexibility and choices for Americans. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to remove certain provisions related to coverage requirements and tax codes. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to repeal provisions related to protecting patients from higher premiums, ensuring affordable coverage, increasing consumer control by repealing restrictions on over-the-counter medicines, and repealing the annual cap. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to repeal the annual cap on coverage, allowing individuals to keep the coverage they like. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to protect employers and consumers with grandfathered coverage in group health plans or insurance. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act protects grandfathered health plans from modifications to cost-sharing levels, employer contributions, or covered benefits. The Secretary will issue regulations to clarify this provision. The amendments made by this section shall take effect as if included in the enactment of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. Any regulations relating to section 1251(a)(2) of such Act promulgated before the date of the enactment of this Act shall have no force or effect.
